it.cnr.isti.labse.glimpse.consumer
Class GlimpseAbstractConsumer

java.lang.Object
  it.cnr.isti.labse.glimpse.consumer.GlimpseAbstractConsumer
All Implemented Interfaces:
GlimpseConsumer, javax.jms.MessageListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
MyGlimpseConsumer
public abstract class GlimpseAbstractConsumer
extends java.lang.Object
implements GlimpseConsumer

This class represent a generic implementation of the interface GlimpseConsumer.
It provides for extension, the abstract method: messageReceived(Message)

Version:
3.2
Author:
Antonello Calabrò

Constructor Detail

GlimpseAbstractConsumer

public GlimpseAbstractConsumer(java.util.Properties settings,
                               java.lang.String plainTextRule)
This constructor allow to create a GlimpseAbstractConsumer object
providing the settings properties and a String object that will be
automatically converted to a ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument object.

Parameters:
settings - can be generated automatically using Manager.createConsumerSettingsPropertiesObject(String, String, String, String, String, String, boolean, String).
plainTextRule - a plain text rule is a String containing the Drools
(or other cep engine implemented) rule that can be generated structured
using the ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument classes.
For a rule example see the exampleRule.xml file.

GlimpseAbstractConsumer

public GlimpseAbstractConsumer(java.util.Properties settings,
                               it.cnr.isti.labse.glimpse.xml.complexEventRule.ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument complexEventRuleXML)
This constructor allow to create a GlimpseAbstractConsumer object
providing the settings properties and a ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument object.

Parameters:
settings - can be generated automatically using Manager.createConsumerSettingsPropertiesObject(String, String, String, String, String, String, boolean, String).
complexEventRuleXML - a ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument object
that contains the set of rule that will be loaded on the CEP knowledge base for the evaluation. The ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument object, can be generated from a string, using the method

sendActionListMessage

public void sendActionListMessage(javax.jms.TopicConnection connection,
                                  javax.naming.InitialContext initContext,
                                  java.lang.String serviceChannel,
                                  it.cnr.isti.labse.glimpse.xml.complexEventRule.ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument actionList,
                                  boolean debug)
                           throws javax.jms.JMSException,
                                  javax.naming.NamingException
Description copied from interface: GlimpseConsumer
Send a ActionList of rules to the monitoring infrastructure requesting an evaluation.
If the request is accepted, the monitoring will answer with a responseChannel where to connect
The actionList parameter is a list of action to provide to the Monitoring
To create it, you can use ComplexEventRuleActionListDocument class.

Specified by:
sendActionListMessage in interface GlimpseConsumer
debug - debug value
Throws:
javax.jms.JMSException
javax.naming.NamingException

examples of setting up connection and behaviour of
a generic GlimpseConsumer are defined in

connectToTheResponseChannel

protected javax.jms.TopicSubscriber connectToTheResponseChannel(javax.jms.TopicConnection connection,
                                                                java.lang.String responseChannel,
                                                                boolean debug)
                                                         throws javax.jms.JMSException
This method connect the Consumer to the response channel where the results of the
requested evaluation to the monitoring infrastructure will be sent on.

Parameters:
connection - the connection object currently used
responseChannel - the channel where to connect to.
The monitoring will provides this parameter after sending the evaluation request.
debug -
Returns:
a TopicSubscriber object
Throws:
javax.jms.JMSException

getAnswerTopicFromTextMessage

protected java.lang.String getAnswerTopicFromTextMessage(javax.jms.TextMessage msg)
                                                  throws javax.jms.JMSException,
                                                         IncorrectRuleFormatException
Parameters:
msg - the first TextMessage received from the monitoring infrastructure,
in response to the submitted evaluation request.
Returns:
a string to be used with the method connectToTheResponseChannel(TopicConnection, String, boolean) method
to connect on the response channel
Throws:
javax.jms.JMSException
IncorrectRuleFormatException
